intro: Monadenium stapelioides, commonly known as the Cape fig or the woolly fig, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its swollen, fleshy stems and thick leaves that store water. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in arid conditions. Monadenium stapelioides is a slow-growing plant that requires minimal water and well-draining soil.
